id: legal obligation that is applicable to a financial instrument or listing as mandated in a law or by contract
name: legal obligation that is applicable to a financial instrument or listing as mandated in a law or by contract

id: regulation codified in law specific to securities and investments
name: regulation codified in law specific to securities and investments

id: investor that is a person, rather than an organization, who may or may not be considered a qualified investor from a legal perspective
name: investor that is a person, rather than an organization, who may or may not be considered a qualified investor from a legal perspective

id: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to eliminate an unused ontology import and to augment the information associated with references needed to define depositary receipts.
name: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to eliminate an unused ontology import and to augment the information associated with references needed to define depositary receipts.

id: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of this ontology was revised to reuse the representation of institutions based on their definitions in the law.
name: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of this ontology was revised to reuse the representation of institutions based on their definitions in the law.

id: identifies a restriction applicable to a given financial instrument or listing
name: identifies a restriction applicable to a given financial instrument or listing

id: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to reflect the change in representation of a listing.
name: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to reflect the change in representation of a listing.

id: Institutional investors typically buy, sell, and manage stocks, bonds, and other investment securities on behalf of its clients, customers, members, or shareholders. These include endowment funds, commercial banks, mutual funds, hedge funds, pension funds, and insurance companies. Institutional investors are able to invest in riskier securities and ventures than average investors because they are more sophisticated with respect to their investment methodologies.
name: Institutional investors typically buy, sell, and manage stocks, bonds, and other investment securities on behalf of its clients, customers, members, or shareholders. These include endowment funds, commercial banks, mutual funds, hedge funds, pension funds, and insurance companies. Institutional investors are able to invest in riskier securities and ventures than average investors because they are more sophisticated with respect to their investment methodologies.

id: investor that pools money to purchase securities, real property, and other investment assets or originates loans
name: investor that pools money to purchase securities, real property, and other investment assets or originates loans

id: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of this ontology was modified to move the property, 'is conferred on' to the Legal Capacity ontology and to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC), eliminating redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.
name: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of this ontology was modified to move the property, 'is conferred on' to the Legal Capacity ontology and to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC), eliminating redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.

id: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to eliminate duplication of concepts in LCC.
name: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to eliminate duplication of concepts in LCC.

id: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to add a definition for institutional investor and move jurisdiction-specific definitions to new ontologies for those jurisdictions (SEC-113).
name: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to add a definition for institutional investor and move jurisdiction-specific definitions to new ontologies for those jurisdictions (SEC-113).

id: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to eliminate elements that have been deprecated over 6 months (FND-386).
name: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to eliminate elements that have been deprecated over 6 months (FND-386).

id: If a holding period is not defined, then the period for which the restriction applies is indefinite.
name: If a holding period is not defined, then the period for which the restriction applies is indefinite.

id: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to eliminate deprecations that are more than 6 months old.
name: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to eliminate deprecations that are more than 6 months old.

id: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to fix spelling errors.
name: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to fix spelling errors.

id: legal holding restriction that defines the concept of a qualified investor for a given purpose and specifies that only such qualified investors may hold the security
name: legal holding restriction that defines the concept of a qualified investor for a given purpose and specifies that only such qualified investors may hold the security

id: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).
name: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).

id: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.
name: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.

id: This ontology defines the concepts related to restrictions on finanicial instruments, securities and listings.
name: This ontology defines the concepts related to restrictions on finanicial instruments, securities and listings.

id: restriction that limits trading in some manner, typically summarized on term sheets or in other documentation, including but not limited to restrictions on day trading
name: restriction that limits trading in some manner, typically summarized on term sheets or in other documentation, including but not limited to restrictions on day trading

id: identifies a holding period applicable to some financial asset
name: identifies a holding period applicable to some financial asset

id: legal holding restriction that specifies where holders of a security may be domiciled
name: legal holding restriction that specifies where holders of a security may be domiciled

id: security restriction applicable to holding the security
name: security restriction applicable to holding the security

id: contract terms setting out restrictions on either the holder or the issuer of the security, as specified in the terms of the instrument itself
name: contract terms setting out restrictions on either the holder or the issuer of the security, as specified in the terms of the instrument itself

id: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to simplify the hierarchy with respect to regulatory requirements and eliminate deprecated elements.
name: SecuritiesRestrictions.rdf version of the ontology was modified to simplify the hierarchy with respect to regulatory requirements and eliminate deprecated elements.
